dt: {bc}to wander from company, restraint, or proper limits
{bc}to roam about without fixed direction or purpose
{bc}to move without conscious or intentional effort
{bc}to become distracted from an argument or train of thought
{bc}to wander accidentally from a fixed or chosen route

et: Middle English {it}straien{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}estraier{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*extravagare{/it}, from Latin {it}extra-{/it} outside + {it}vagari{/it} to wander {ma}{mat|extra-|}{/ma}
shortdef: to wander from company, restraint, or proper limits
to roam about without fixed direction or purpose
